name: Las Gaviotas Suites Hotel

reviews.text: A wonderful hotel, very trendy, excellent food and facilities and really nice friendly professional staff especially Lena. This is not your typical package hotel.it's very cosmopolitan the rooms are great and very clean along with the spa, fitness room and restaurant.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel..Excellent

reviews.text: The food was also lovely with a great choice daily.. All round 5 Stars!!! Thank you
reviews.title: Excellent stay in a good hotel

reviews.text: 1 minute walk to the beach, 10mins bus to Alcudia at €1..The best of both worlds
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Las Gaviotas is a very nice hotel. The rooms are impressive & spacious with a good bathroom / wet room. Everywhere is spotless and the cleaner comes every day. Bar area is very fashionable with tables out into the street which is always full of people in the evening. The reception and bar merge together and there is wi-fi in both areas which you can also pick up round the pools. There are two outdoor pools and an indoor and outdoor spa area. Breakfast is plentiful and very good.
reviews.title: Very nice stay at las gaviotas suites

reviews.text: The hotel do need to decide on their policy with regards to children. Despite the fact there is a quiet pool for adults, even the second bigger pool does not allow lilo's and at times you are asked not to use beach balls!! If older children are welcome they should be catered for. One other point is that although generally the staff in the hotel were very friendly, the one exception was the young girl who watched the pool. She was exceptionally rude on a number of occasions to guests paying a lot of money who were obviously perplexed by these changing rules.
reviews.title: Good hotel but in wrong location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a week at Gaviotas. It was a very good hotel for peace and quiet,however it was slightly clinical,as everything was white and chrome.
reviews.title: Slightly Clinical !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hopefully won't put you off going,because it was exceptionally clean.
reviews.title: MET EXPECTATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the desk were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: A good 4 star that needs a little sparkle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast had an excellent choice of food,too much to list here!!
reviews.title: High standard, excellent

reviews.text: We had a suite over looking the large pool,and would you believe that at any time of the day there were sunbeds available,as there was only a few die-hards that had to get their pick first thing in the morning!
reviews.title: Family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the recommendation of friends who come here often.
reviews.title: Great hotel, shame about the location
Fabulous!!
reviews.text: THE HOTEL

Overall the hotel is excellent in many ways. It is very clean, the rooms are generously sized and the fixtures and fittings are of a high quality. We had a room on the top floor overlooking the bigger pool which was a bit noisy but didn't really disrupt us, and we had great views of the surrounding countryside. The pools are nice places to spend time in and around and there is a small indoor spa pool with a sauna and steam room which seems to get hardly used. We both had an hour long massage which was fairly good value at 50 euros. The drinks are cheap about £2 for a large beer or very large glass of wine) and the food at the poolside bar is of a very good quality and sensibly priced. The staff are also superb and really helpful. We stayed bed and breakfast and found the dining room a bit too busy and noisy for our liking. We did tend to eat late, so perhaps if we'd gone earlier it would have been better. We also found it a bit hit and miss as to what was on offer. There was also no table service, meaning you had to go and get tea and coffee yourself. Curiously there were also no tea and coffee facilities in the room (even a Travelodge room has them), and you had to pay to hire a safe. But these are really minor gripes and for the price we paid, at peak season, we were satisfied.
reviews.title: Fab hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION AND SURROUNDING AREA
reviews.title: 100% excellence
Excellent hotel and location
reviews.text: The big thing that lets the hotel down is its location. It is on a main road through the centre of the resort with constant traffic. There is a bar terrace at the front which would be a lot nicer if they put some terracing and shrubbery/fencing up to shield it from the constant noise. We also felt they were missing a trick by not having a bar at the rear of the hotel around the big pool. The resort itself is very disappointing. Aside from a bizarrely large number of Spar stores and a few tacky bars and restaurants, there is not much to see - although the beach is nice but very crowded. We took to getting the bus to Alcudia Old Town and Port D'alcudia in the evening where there are many more restaurants and generally more pleasant surroundings. However the bus service can be a bit erratic and be aware that they get very crowded from 7-8pm and 10-11pm. We also drove to Soller one day which was very pleasant - but make sure you take the Palma road route otherwise you will end up dizzy from the number of hairpin bends! Port Pallenca is also recommended, although at night the bus stops running at 9pm and a taxi will cost you almost 20 euros.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only after reading all the constant brilliant reviews of this hotel we booked this through Thomson for the first week of July. Coach dropped us off round the corner from the hotel, driver of the coach just pointed in the direction of the hotel. First impressions were really good, lovely reception. Our suite was on the ground floor and when entering it smelt musty and a drain type smell greeted us. Suite was beautiful, equipped with fridge which came in very handy. Our room backed the other hotels rear car park, so every night we had to endue their bins being emptied, early morning delivery drivers etc. Every evening at 11pm the sprinklers came on which completely soaked the balcony. Our main problem was the food, it was always cold, you were ok if you got there when it had just come out but if it had been sitting there it was always cold, not impressed at all with the selection of food, we had to rely on the chef for his grills. If you got to the restaurant early then you had a good choice of desserts, but I think the motto is once its gone its gone and not replaced.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a good point the beach was fantastic, very shallow and some good waves. Came across being able to reserve your beach sunbeds for 5 or 10 days, so most of these were booked out, at least you didn't have to rush down to the beach early every morning to get some, never seen that before in Majorca, not sure if that just happens in Playa de Muro or all over Majorca now.
reviews.title: Must book this hotel..!

reviews.text: Didn't see a Thomson rep all week, there was no welcome pack delivered to us, no contact numbers in case of emergencies.
reviews.title: great stay, excellent food

reviews.text: The airport coming home was horrendous we had to queue for over half an hour to get through showing our passports before the departure lounge then our flight was delayed by an hour so that was just the icing on the cake really to this holiday.
reviews.title: Amazing, modern, fantastic staff and the list goes on!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travelled in June to Las Gaviotas for 5 nights with my girlfriend. Neither of us had been to Playa De Muro before so had trust Trip Advisor on providing us with ideas of hotels and decided on las Gaviotas... Let me say we were not dissapointed. Long review so i have put a little info on each area...
reviews.title: Great quiet hotel

aka: Las Gaviotas Hotel Playa De Muro
